title: US EV Charging Network Expands to 1 Million Stations Nationwide
introText: The United States has reached one million EV charging stations, tripling infrastructure in three years. The expansion addresses range anxiety and supports accelerating electric vehicle adoption.

content.content: One million charging stations are now operational across the US, including 200,000 DC fast chargers capable of 80% charge in 20 minutes. Every interstate highway exit within 50 miles of a major city has charging.
The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act provided $7.5 billion for charging deployment. Private investment has contributed an additional $15 billion.
Range anxiety has diminished significantly. EV owners report charging infrastructure is no longer a barrier to purchase, accelerating the transition from gasoline vehicles.
